level.heading: MARKING OF BALLOTS BY ELECTION OFFICIALS (§ 3-804)

level.text: No election official shall make a mark on any ballot, except for the following reasons:
Upon the voter’s request, to assist a voter with the act of voting;
To note whether a ballot is partially or totally invalid;
To indicate the ballot’s status as a Special Ballot; or
To facilitate vote counting procedures, when authorized by the Executive Director or his or her designee.
The notations of validity or invalidity shall be contained within administrative procedures.
